responsibilities: Collaborate with program/project managers to develop milestones and deliverables.
Use existing procedures and tools to develop and safely execute network changes, and occasionally develop new procedures.
Develop solutions to enable front line support teams to act on network failure conditions.
Participate in network solution and architecture design process and contribute to roadmaps development.
Participate in operational rotations as either primary or secondary.
Provide break-fix support for events and serve as the escalation point for event remediation.
Develop scripts to automate routine tasks for team and business units.
Coordinate with networking automation services for the development and integration of support tooling.
Coordinate with network monitoring to gather telemetry and create alert rules.
Build dashboards to represent data at various network layers and device roles to help identify network issues and anomalies.
Serve as SME on software development projects for network automation and network monitoring.
Collaborate with network vendor technical account team and internal Quality Assurance team to drive bug resolution and assist in the qualification of new firmware and/or operating systems.
skills: Strong knowledge of protocols such as MPLS, BGP/OSPF/IS-IS, TCP, IPv4, IPv6, DNS, and DHCP.
Extensive experience with scripting or automation, preferably in Python, but must demonstrate expertise in scripting or compiled language.
Experience with networking protocols such as TCP/IP, VPN, DNS, DHCP, and SSL.
Experience with network monitoring and telemetry solutions.
Experience with network modeling and programming – YANG, OpenConfig, NETCONF.
Ability to use professional concepts and company objectives to resolve complex issues creatively and effectively.
Excellent organizational, verbal, and written communication skills.
Excellent judgment in influencing product roadmap direction, features, and priorities.
analysis: The job responsibilities and skills listed are primarily focused on network engineering, automation, and monitoring. The responsibilities include tasks such as developing network solutions, automating routine tasks, providing support for network events, and collaborating with network vendors. The skills required include knowledge of networking protocols, scripting or automation expertise, and experience with network monitoring and telemetry solutions. There is no mention of Generative AI (GenAI) or language models (LLMs) in the responsibilities or skills. The focus is on network infrastructure, automation, and monitoring rather than AI or language model development or application.
